purpose: Find the maximum value in a set of numbers
titleCardParagraphs: Excel's MAX function returns the largest value from the numbers provided. This page shows how to implement Excel's MAX function in Python using pandas.

paragraphs: The MAX function in Excel takes one or more arguments (ranges of numbers or individual numbers) and returns the largest value among them.

syntaxTable.description: The first number you want to compare.
(Optional) Additional numbers you want to compare.
(Optional) Add up to 255 numbers you want to compare.

examplesTable.description: Find the largest value among 1, 5, and 7.
Find the maximum value in the range A1 to A10.

introParagraphs: There are a few common ways to use the MAX function. Below are copy-ready Python implementations for some of the most common use cases.

codeSections.title: Finding the Maximum Value in a Series
paragraphs: In Excel, if you want to find the maximum value in a column, you'd use the formula =MAX(A:A). The formula returns the highest value in the range A:A.

paragraphs: If you want to determine the highest value in an entire Excel sheet, you'd use the MAX function on the entire range. For example, if you had data in column A through G, you'd use the formula =MAX(A:G).

codeSections.title: Ignoring NaN Values
paragraphs: Just like Excel, by default, pandas excludes NaN values (aka missing values) when calculating the maximum. However, if the entire column or row contains only NaNs, the result will be NaN.
